title: AWS Services Essentials
description: In-depth AWS course covering key services, architecture, IAM, compute, storage, networking, and monitoring.

subtopics.title: Introduction to AWS
subtopics.content: Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world's largest cloud platform, offering compute, storage, networking, databases, analytics, machine learning, and more, on-demand.

subtopics.title: AWS Global Infrastructure
subtopics.content: AWS regions are physical locations worldwide. Each region has multiple isolated Availability Zones (AZs) for high availability.

subtopics.title: Identity and Access Management (IAM)
subtopics.content: IAM controls user and service permissions. IAM components: Users, Groups, Roles, Policies. Principle of least privilege is recommended.

subtopics.title: Compute Services: EC2 and Lambda
subtopics.content:
- EC2: Virtual servers in the cloud. Choose instance type, OS, security groups.
- Lambda: Serverless compute. Run code in response to events, pay only for usage.

subtopics.title: Storage Services: S3 and EBS
subtopics.content:
- S3: Scalable object storage for files, backups, static sites.
- EBS: Block storage attached to EC2 instances.

subtopics.title: Networking: VPC, Subnets, and Security Groups
subtopics.content: VPC (Virtual Private Cloud) lets you provision a logically isolated network. Subnets divide VPC into segments. Security Groups control inbound/outbound traffic.

subtopics.title: Databases: RDS and DynamoDB
subtopics.content:
- RDS: Managed relational database (MySQL, PostgreSQL, Oracle, SQL Server).
- DynamoDB: Managed NoSQL database.

subtopics.title: Monitoring: CloudWatch
subtopics.content: CloudWatch monitors AWS resources and applications in real time. Use metrics, logs, and alarms to automate responses.

subtopics.title: Autoscaling and Load Balancers
subtopics.content: Auto Scaling adjusts EC2 capacity to demand. Elastic Load Balancer (ELB) distributes incoming traffic to multiple EC2 instances for fault tolerance.

subtopics.title: AWS CLI and SDKs
subtopics.content: AWS CLI enables command-line management of AWS services. SDKs are available for many programming languages.

subtopics.title: AWS Security Best Practices
subtopics.content:
- Enable MFA on root account
- Use IAM roles for EC2
- Encrypt data at rest and in transit
- Use CloudTrail for auditing
